User-Contributed Vignettes

Chester Ismay

2020-06-05

Source: vignettes/user_contributed_vignettes.Rmd
user_contributed_vignettes.Rmd

Due to CRAN space limitations on packages, user-contributed vignettes that walk through different analyses using the data sets in the fivethirtyeight package are linked below in this “vignette of vignettes.” Each vignette has two links: 1) An HTML version of the vignette available at the package website and 2) the corresponding .Rmd R Markdown source code available on GitHub.

  • Bechdel analysis using the tidyverse by Chester Ismay (Rmd)
  • Bob Ross - Joy of Painting by Jonathan Bouchet (Rmd)
  • Gender in Comic Books by Jonathan Bouchet (Rmd)
  • How Many Fucks Does Tarantino Give? by Olivia Barrows, Jojo Miller, and Jayla Nakayama (Rmd)
  • Looking at the Biopics of Hollywood by Pradeep Adhokshaja (Rmd)
  • 2015 NBA player predictions analysis using the tidyverse by G. Elliott Morris (with support from Chester Ismay) (Rmd)
  • Trump Twitter analysis using the tidyverse by Adam Spannbauer (with support from Jennifer Chunn) (Rmd)

You can also install a version of the package that includes all vignettes by installing the development version of the fivethirtyeight package using thee remotes package and then view a list of all vignettes:

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("rudeboybert/fivethirtyeight", build_vignettes = TRUE)
vignette(package = "fivethirtyeight")

Developed by Albert Y. Kim, Chester Ismay, Jennifer Chunn.

Site built with pkgdown 1.5.1.
